com.google.gcloud.storage

Class Bucket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gcloud.storage.Bucket

  • public final class Bucket
extends Object
    A Google cloud storage bucket.

    Objects of this class are immutable. Operations that modify the bucket like update(com.google.gcloud.storage.BucketInfo, com.google.gcloud.storage.Storage.BucketTargetOption...) return a new object. To get a Bucket object with the most recent information use reload(com.google.gcloud.storage.Bucket.BucketSourceOption...).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Bucket.BucketSourceOption
      Class for specifying bucket source options when Bucket methods are used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bucket

        public Bucket(Storage storage,
              BucketInfo info)
        Constructs a Bucket object for the provided BucketInfo. The storage service is used to issue requests.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used for issuing requests
        info - bucket's info

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static Bucket get(Storage storage,
                         String bucket,
                         Storage.BucketGetOption... options)
        Creates a Bucket object for the provided bucket name. Performs an RPC call to get the latest bucket information.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used for issuing requests
        bucket - bucket's name
        options - blob get options
        Returns:
        the Bucket object or null if not found
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • info

        public BucketInfo info()
        Returns the bucket's information.

      • exists

        public boolean exists(Bucket.BucketSourceOption... options)
        Checks if this bucket exists.
        Returns:
        true if this bucket exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • reload

        public Bucket reload(Bucket.BucketSourceOption... options)
        Fetches current bucket's latest information. Returns null if the bucket does not exist.
        Parameters:
        options - bucket read options
        Returns:
        a Bucket object with latest information or null if not found
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • update

        public Bucket update(BucketInfo bucketInfo,
                     Storage.BucketTargetOption... options)
        Updates the bucket's information. Bucket's name cannot be changed. A new Bucket object is returned. By default no checks are made on the metadata generation of the current bucket. If you want to update the information only if the current bucket metadata are at their latest version use the metagenerationMatch option: bucket.update(newInfo, BucketTargetOption.metagenerationMatch())
        Parameters:
        bucketInfo - new bucket's information. Name must match the one of the current bucket
        options - update options
        Returns:
        a Bucket object with updated information
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • delete

        public boolean delete(Bucket.BucketSourceOption... options)
        Deletes this bucket.
        Parameters:
        options - bucket delete options
        Returns:
        true if bucket was deleted, false if it was not found
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • list

        public Page<Blob> list(Storage.BlobListOption... options)
        Returns the paginated list of Blob in this bucket.
        Parameters:
        options - options for listing blobs
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • get

        public Blob get(String blob,
                Storage.BlobGetOption... options)
        Returns the requested blob in this bucket or null if not found.
        Parameters:
        blob - name of the requested blob
        options - blob search options
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • get

        public List<Blob> get(String blobName1,
                      String blobName2,
                      String... blobNames)
        Returns a list of requested blobs in this bucket. Blobs that do not exist are null.
        Parameters:
        blobName1 - first blob to get
        blobName2 - second blob to get
        blobNames - other blobs to get
        Returns:
        an immutable list of Blob objects
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • create

        public Blob create(String blob,
                   byte[] content,
                   String contentType,
                   Storage.BlobTargetOption... options)
        Creates a new blob in this bucket. Direct upload is used to upload content. For large content, Blob.writer(com.google.gcloud.storage.Storage.BlobWriteOption...) is recommended as it uses resumable upload. MD5 and CRC32C hashes of content are computed and used for validating transferred data.
        Parameters:
        blob - a blob name
        content - the blob content
        contentType - the blob content type. If null then "application/octet-stream" is used.
        options - options for blob creation
        Returns:
        a complete blob information
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • create

        public Blob create(String blob,
                   InputStream content,
                   String contentType,
                   Storage.BlobWriteOption... options)
        Creates a new blob in this bucket. Direct upload is used to upload content. For large content, Blob.writer(com.google.gcloud.storage.Storage.BlobWriteOption...) is recommended as it uses resumable upload.
        Parameters:
        blob - a blob name
        content - the blob content as a stream
        contentType - the blob content type. If null then "application/octet-stream" is used.
        options - options for blob creation
        Returns:
        a complete blob information
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • storage

        public Storage storage()
        Returns the bucket's Storage object used to issue requests.
